description: Conversion of house into seven self-contained flats; three storey (lower ground to first floor level) front extension (following demolition of existing garage); three storey (lower ground to first floor level) and lower ground floor rear extensions; external alterations; parking; and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The proposed rear extension by reason of its siting, height, rear projection and proximity to boundaries would have an unacceptable overbearing and enclosing effect on the amenity of nearby occupiers with regard to loss of outlook and access to daylight, contrary to policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The front extension would be out of character with the general style and pattern of development in the area, harmful to visual amenity and causing harm to the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, contrary to policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The location of parking spaces and the refuse storage facility at the front of the site would result in a loss of landscaping, thereby having an adverse visual impact upon the appearance of the site, and causing harm to the character and appearance of the conservation area, contrary to policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
